Posts.Title: My hair has finally decided to leave the building!

Posts.Content: Wow,sume,sounds like the hospital California. Don't put up with that crappy treatment. If its anything like that again complain in writing.you will find that that's what nurses and doctors want you to do as they are understaffed and over worked.complaining does work.I would have walked out. Best wishes in the future Tony
Posts.Title: Feeling stressed

Posts.Content: Susie.fantastic you are getting better.gives a lot of folks encouragement To go through the crap and know there a pot of gold at the end called normality.
Posts.Title: Another tiny step

Posts.Content: Thanks Maggie.hoped you guys don't mind me highjacking you forum.I feel that as we all have cancer in common there are lots of side effects we can give our advice on.just wish others would comment sometimes to other forums as they must be fountains of knowlage we can share between groups. Tony
Posts.Title: chemo fog

Posts.Content: Hi Maggie.fear not you are not alone in this.forgetting what you were gonna say mid sentence. Memory loss.etc are very common.may find yourself pouring your hot water into the sugar bowl instead of coffee cup and silly things like that but that's what a lot call chemo brain.as I did things like that during senior moments I don't worry bout it to much.lol.I feel not only does fatigue affect the body it also goes for the grey matter. Sure others will tell you some off there experiences. Best wishes Tony
Posts.Title: chemo fog

Posts.Content: Fantastic news.now you can get on with the future.so pleased for you and your loved ones Tony
Posts.Title: survivor

Posts.Content: After having two Hickman line inserted and remove painlessly I was not ready for the pain I had when the portocast was put in.took weeks for it to settle.as others have suggested if there's no sign of infection I would not be overtly worried but I would also get it checked out. Best wishes Tony
